titleInfo.title: EXPRESSING THE SENSE OF THE HOUSE ABOUT A NATIONAL STRATEGY FOR THE INTERNET OF THINGS

extension.searchTitle: EXPRESSING THE SENSE OF THE HOUSE ABOUT A NATIONAL STRATEGY FOR THE INTERNET OF THINGS; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 137

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives about a national strategy for the Internet of Things to promote economic growth and consumer empowerment
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Res. 847, expressing the sense of the House of Representatives about a national strategy for the Internet of Things to promote economic growth and consumer empowerment, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 367 yeas to 4 nays with one answering ``present'', Roll No. 496;

titleInfo.title: EXPRESSING THE SENSE OF THE HOUSE REGARDING A NATIONAL POLICY FOR TECHNOLOGY TO PROMOTE CONSUMERS' ACCESS TO FINANCIAL TOOLS AND ONLINE COMMERCE

extension.searchTitle: EXPRESSING THE SENSE OF THE HOUSE REGARDING A NATIONAL POLICY FOR TECHNOLOGY TO PROMOTE CONSUMERS' ACCESS TO FINANCIAL TOOLS AND ONLINE COMMERCE; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 137

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States should adopt a national policy for technology to promote consumers' access to financial tools and online commerce to promote economic growth and consumer empowerment
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Res. 835, expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States should adopt a national policy for technology to promote consumers' access to financial tools and online commerce to promote economic growth and consumer empowerment, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 385 yeas to 4 nays with one answering ``present'', Roll No. 497;
